meanings.definition: An opinion or judgment formed beforehand without full knowledge or examination of the facts.
meanings.sent1: Her prejudgments about the new student turned out to be completely wrong.
meanings.sent2: His prejudgments about the movie influenced his decision to not watch it.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's prejudgments about cats being lazy were shattered when she met a playful kitten.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of prejudgments clouded his ability to see the truth clearly.
meanings.sent5: Prejudgments can prevent us from seeing things as they truly are.

meanings.sent1: The manager's prejudgments affected his hiring decisions.
meanings.sent2: She tried to challenge her own prejudgments by learning more about different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The cat's prejudgments about the vacuum cleaner led to hilarious hiding spots.
meanings.sent4: His prejudgments acted as a barrier to forming new friendships.
meanings.sent5: Prejudgments can limit our understanding of others if we don't question them.
